titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. William Jones and Jack G. Davis, Judgment
CWG10922

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Bourbon Circuit Court
October Term 1858
The Commonwealth Plaintiff
vs } Towit altering & passing counterfeit money
William Jones and Jack G Davis Defendants
The parties appeared by their attorneys and the defendants by their attorneys, and plead that they are not guilty of the charge contained in the Indictment.

And thereupon the following Jurors, Harvey W Letton, Francis Hardesty, C C Skillman, Thomas Stone, David Dodge, Valentine Hildreth, Isral L Becraft, James K Jameson, Thomas L Arnold, Jeremiah Duncan, Jesse H Boulden, and Warren B Rogers, were Sworn to try the issue and having heard the evidence returned the following verdict "We of the Jury find William Jones and Jack. G. Davis guilty as charged in this indictment and fix the term to Six years confinement in the State Penetin Penetentiary Thomas L Arnold foreman"

A Copy
Att James Paton C, B, C, C
By John G Paton D C B C C

Commonwealth
vs } indictment for altering and passing counterfiet money
Davis & Jones

Issued pardon for Davis -- B. M.
J. G Davis
Issd July 12 1861
